definition: to transmit/to lead/to guide/to conduct/to direct

sentences.english: Jackman reportedly requested to have Luhrmann stage the Oscar number.
sentences.chinese: 據稱傑克曼竭力邀請魯爾曼執導奧斯卡舞臺。

sentences.english: The opera was directed by the well-known Chinese director, Zhang Yimou.
sentences.chinese: 歌劇由中國著名導演張藝謀執導。

sentences.english: George Clooney also directed the film and co-wrote the script.
sentences.chinese: 喬治克魯尼執導的電影和合作寫劇本。

sentences.english: she helmed a film called ‘Filth and Wisdom’ in 2008.
sentences.chinese: 08年她執導了一部名爲《下流與智慧》的電影。

sentences.english: I am not even sure that I am going to do that film.
sentences.chinese: 我甚至不知道未來還能否執導《銃夢》。

sentences.english: This is the same man who directed " The Rock" in 1996.
sentences.chinese: 這傢伙在1996年的時候執導過《石破天驚》。

sentences.english: Eragon is his first feature film.
sentences.chinese: 《龍騎士》是他執導的第一部劇情片。

sentences.english: The barber is the last film directed by Mr. Chen Yifei.
sentences.chinese: 理髮師》這部電影是陳逸飛先生執導的最後一部電影。

sentences.english: Who wants to watch some aerial battles filmed in IMAX by John Woo?
sentences.chinese: 誰想看吳宇森執導的IMAX版的空戰電影啊？

sentences.english: Wujing indicated that directs the first movie regarding oneself, he works hard.
sentences.chinese: 吳京表示，對於自己執導的首部電影，他非常下工夫。

sentences.english: Both Aniston and Moore have previously directed short films.
sentences.chinese: 安妮斯頓和摩爾之前都有過執導電影短片的經歷。

sentences.english: We’ll probably co-direct the third one.
sentences.chinese: 而第三部很有可能由我們共同執導。

sentences.english: This isn’t Madonna’s first directorial outing; she helmed a film called ‘Filth and Wisdom’ in 2008.
sentences.chinese: 這並非麥當娜首次執導。

sentences.english: The film will be Chow's directorial and acting debut in Hollywood.
sentences.chinese: 這將是周星馳在好萊塢執導並出演的處女作。

sentences.english: Affleck will costar as well as direct the picture.
sentences.chinese: 而阿弗萊克不僅會出演電影，還將執導該片。

sentences.english: Robin became famous for directing "A World According to Monsanto".
sentences.chinese: 羅賓曾因執導《孟山都公司眼中的世界》而名聲大噪。

definition: to supervise the manufacture of/to supervise the shooting of films/executive producer (film)
to hold a governmental office or post/to assume office of/to take charge of/to serve as
to rely on/to depend on/by means of/thanks to/sth that one relies on/also written 憑借|凭借[ping2 jie4]
cutting-edge (in technology, science, fashion, the arts etc)/novel and competitive/new and dashing
to begin shooting (a movie, a scene of a movie etc)/to start the bidding (auction)/to start a trading session (stock market)
